thread.title: Editorial week in review: Oct. 5-10
thread.title_full: Editorial week in review: Oct. 5-10 | OregonLive.com

author: The Oregonian Editorial Board
title: Editorial week in review: Oct. 5-10
text:
Monday, Oct. 5
Naming Oregon shooter: Keeping anonymous the name of the 26-year-old who killed nine people and wounded nine others at Umpqua Community College only hurts the investigation's credibility and the quality of the public debate that must occur.
Tuesday, Oct. 6
Portland gas tax: The state's clean-fuels mandate could get in the way of the latest proposal for funding street improvements.
Wednesday, Oct. 7
Minors and marijuana: Underage pot use demands attention , and containment, in the era of legalization.
Trans-Pacific Partnership: The 12-country trade deal completed Monday would boost Oregon's economy.
Thursday, Oct. 8
Anti-coal push: The Legislature, not the ballot, is the proper venue for a complex and potentially costly mandate.
Friday, Oct. 9
New Seasons wage hike: Portland's beacon of progressive capitalism is increasing its starting wage , revealing some of the issues businesses will have to grapple with if the minimum wage is increased.
Rape kit testing: Oregon law enforcement agencies are coming up with long overdue proposals for testing of rape kits .
Saturday, Oct. 10
Peaks and valleys: An editorial look at the week's highs and lows.
